subject: Appeals Courts (US)
Organized Labor
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court denied a petition to rehear an attempt by the Major League Baseball Players Association and Major League Baseball Advanced Media to get a ruling reversed that allows a fantasy baseball company to use players’ names and statistics without paying a licensing fee. A three-judge panel of the Eighth United States Circuit Court of Appeals ruled last month that the company, CBC Distribution and Marketing Inc., did not have to pay players, even though it profits by using their names and statistics. The motion was denied without explanation.
